basis: User explicitly commits to trying a tiny sip of water now and proceeding at their own pace with no pressure to eat, indicating alignment with the suggestion.
cognitive_dissonance: Tension between wanting to avoid eating due to heat/mood and the plan to hydrate first; struggle between autonomy/avoidance of rigid guidance and following a cooperative, low-pressure protocol.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about meals; worries about appetite in extreme heat; tendency to resist prescriptive guidance.
emotional_triggers: Heat, irregular schedule, mood fluctuations, fatigue/stress from hot weather.
coaching_notes: Continue validating flexibility and autonomy. Reinforce small, tangible actions (micro-sips, ultra-light options) and acknowledge mood/weather factors. Offer simple, moment-by-moment choices and check-ins to sustain engagement.
